result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Extradition Fees in the amount of $2225.00 incurred for transport from Edinburgh, Texas.  The Extradition Fees are to be paid through the Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund (WISCTF) in the same manner as Defendant's Court ordered support payments.  Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment.

Defendant to maintain timely, uninterrupted payments as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 2009FA000097.  Orders subject to modification in the future by further order of the Court. All payments are to be paid through the Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund (WISCTF), not through the Department of Corrections.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes: Huber Privileges granted. No Good Time credit.  Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Court re-imposes costs not previously paid to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.   Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan. 11:07 am cases called-09FA97, 16CF18 & 16CF24. Defendant Juan  Rodriguez in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF24-Revocation Order and warrant received by both counsel. Correction stated by Attorney Patzer. No corrections by DA Anderson besides the ones addresses by Attorney Patzer. Sentencing argument by DA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Patzer. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 3 years Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 1 year Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision. Credit for 173 days served. Concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS OF ES: Pay Child Support as ordered in Waushara County case 2009FA97. Maintain full time employment. Court re-imposes costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP. Appeal Rights Given. 
09FA97-Warrant canceled and requests review hearing in 2019 once calendar is available and release date is confirmed. Court also suspends for review purposes 96CF18. Attorney Zouski requests the amounts due based on age to be turned over to SDC. Court orders the amount due to be turned over to SDC.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 18, 2018 at 11:00 am.
In WC Jail

records.addlTxt: 09FA-97 and 16CF-24 - Both Cases Called @ 4:05 PM: Defendant Juan  Rodriguez in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Corporation Counsel Ruth Zouski also in Court.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today. Per Atty Johnson - Def will be accepting State's offer on resolution.  ADA recites resolution with argued terms on SEH - largely as to cond'l jail request.  Counsel prepared to stipulate to 56 days of TS credit.    Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant - gone over in the Spanish language.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained with potential for deportation. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 and Ct 2:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Ct 3 DRI.  Argument as to SEH by ADA.  Argument as to SEH by Atty Johnson - argues for lesser cond'l time - with time served sentence.  Statement by Def prior to SEH:  Yes.  The Court:  S/W - 4 yrs probation.  Conditions:  As to Ct 1 only - 120 days WCJ as to Ct 1 only Huber, 56 days of TS credit; no GT credit; Conditions as to Both Counts:  Pay CSUP as ordered as to companion 09FA-97 in whatever amount is directed by the Court, orders subject to future modification by the further order of Court; maintain FT employment; Court Costs plus the $2225 Ext Fees from Lock & Load incurred also ordered;  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Defendant advised of firearm warning due to conviction entered.  As to 09FA-97:  Corp Counsel requests SWO upon release form custody with a Review Hrg on 12/14/2016 with Def being allowed to appear via telephone.  SWO imposed as of the first full week of release from incarceration until FT employment is obtained.  Def authorized to appear via telephone for the Review Hrg scheduled for 12/14/2016.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case called @ 3:53 p.m. Defendant Juan Rodriguez in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson.  Defendant Juan Rodriguez in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP entered.   P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
WI Lock & Load Prisoner Transports LLC Invoice, Dated 7/19/2016 - $2225.00
Initial appearance on August 10, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Defendant to maintain timely, uninterrupted payments as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 09FA97.  Defendant is not to leave the State of Wisconsin.

1:40 pm case called. 09FA97 & 16CF24-Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Juan Rodriguez in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Juan Rodriguez in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint stated-confirm receipt, waive formal reading. Riverside Ruling in Favor of State.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
